entry.title: [iOS][finch-first-run] Add metric for FRE seed application
entry.content:
This CL adds a new metric to track the stage of iOS first run

variations seed fetching and application. This is done for two

purposes:



1. Check the percentage of Finchable FRE on iOS executions that

actually leads to a seed being applied on first run.



2. Enables long term monitoring of Finchable FRE on iOS. Ideally, this

metric should be fired for all iOS FRE instances with FRE finchability

enabled, so the total count of this metric of each experiment group in

any study should be similar. If all metrics are fired from the default

group, it means that the seed is not applied and the FRE finchability

feature is somehow broken. A Chirp notification subscription of this

metric on a never ending study (Uniformity studies, for example) will

be used, so iOS team members get email notifications when the feature

breaks, instead of having to proactively running manual performance

checks.



More info: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ccbTmluBJEdizBGaIhPHug5JZ9wF0jDg08TfUF1qvds/edit?usp=sharing



IOSChromeVariationsSeedStore is expanded to keep track of first run

stage. Since more static variables and APIs are introduced, a test

suite is added to verify the integration between the native seed store

and the core variations service.



Bug: 1458395

2023-06-30 jsobczak@google.com Specialize ExceptionOr

> ExceptionOr::ok() returns true if the value is set. This can be misleading

> for boolean types.

> ExceptionOr result = SomeFunction();

> if (result.ok()) {

> if (result.result() {

> // Case 1: SomeFunction returned true

> } else {

> // Case 2: SomeFunction returned false

> } else {

> // Case 3: SomeFunction returned an exception

> }

> It's easy to overlook case 2.

> The specialized ExceptionOr::ok() returns false in Case 2, which allows

> us to write:

> if (result) {

> // SomeFunction returned true

> } else {

> // SomeFunction returned false or an exception

> // result.GetException() can be used if we need to handle different exceptions

> // differenty

> }

>

> PiperOrigin-RevId: 544715641

>

entry.title: float: Pre flight CL for supporting float to bottom left in clamshell
entry.content:
Instead of floating to the bottom right, we will float to the bottom

left if alt is pressed in the multitask menu. This CL sets up by

altering some of the classes needed to perform this. No functional

changes.



- Introduces enum FloatStartLocation.

- Adds WindowFloatWMEvent which holds FloatStartLocation.

- Pipes FloatStartLocation and WindowFloatWMEvent through the relevant

classes and functions for clamshell mode.

- Removes "Preferred" from float bounds functions, since all users

directly use the returned bounds.

- Changes ToggleFloat to SetFloat(FloatStartLocation) and UnsetFloat(),

since it was strange to have ToggleFloat(FloatStartLocation) and

have the arg used very sparingly.



Future CLs will:

- Hook up to multitask menu.

- Support lacros and tablet mode.



Test: existing tests

entry.title: Enforce fully qualified names for custom fields
entry.content:
- It's often the case for Scalable Iph to enable several IPH features in

a single config. Fully qualified names are required to specify

different param values for different IPH features enabled in a single

config.

- This CL enforces the usage of fully qualified names.

By default, non-fully-qualified names can work as a fallback which can

cause a surprise behavior for a config author.



Bug: b:289425874

entry.title: Fix instances of empty brace-initialized raw_ptr<> members.
entry.content:
raw_ptr<> is complex and not all implementations may do what is

expected for this particular case, even if the shipping versions

do. It is safer to use explicit nullptr assignment.



This is in keeping with the guideline from base/memory/raw_ptr.md

which says that "You should continue to explicitly initialize

raw_ptr members to ensure consistent behavior on platforms where

USE_BACKUP_REF_PTR is disabled."

entry.title: [CDM] Extending ModelExecutionManager to provide support default models.
entry.content:
[CDM] = Caching Default Models

In this CL, ModelExecutionManager is extended to provide support for

default models. Following things have been added for the same:

1. Provides model providers for both server and default

models. Currently it stores model providers for server, it would

be extended to store model providers for default models in future.

2. Handling InitAndFetch for server/default model.

3. Storing the latest model metadata in database, even for default



In next set of CLs:

- Rename ModelExecutionManager to ModelManager.

- Handle OnSegmentationModelUpdated for default models, legacy as well

as multi output path.

- Updating SegmentResultProvider to use default models in database

while model execution.

- Migrating DefaultModelManager callers.

- Depreacting DefaultModelManager and migrating ownership of default

model providers to this class.

entry.title: Parse rgb() like other color functions
entry.content:
Previously, rgb() and rgba() parsers were compressing all four color

channels and alpha to 8-bit integers. This is no longer necessary, as

blink::Color stores the parameters as floats.



As we move towards implementing relative color, the more unified the

color parsing is, the easier the eventual implementation will be.



After some discussion for Interop 2023, it was decided that non-finite

color parameters should round-trip and be resolved sanely:

http://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/8629

This new requirement obviously puts us well out of 8-bit integer

territory.



Unfortunately, there are clearly still some code paths that are

independently compressing alpha to be an 8-bit integer and unless

we explicitly do this in the parser, many tests fail. A TODO has been

added to address this issue.



Here is the test change proposal: https://github.com/web-platform-tests/interop/issues/369



Gradient tests with png expectations are pretty brittle, as evidenced

by the per-platform expectations. This change requires a rebaseline

because color channels are not squashed to [0,255] integer range at

the endpoints. So inputs like:

conic-gradient(rgb(0%, 75%, 25%), rgb(0%, 25%, 75%));

No longer become equivalent to:

conic-gradient(rgb(0, 191, 63), rgb(0, 63, 191));

25% of 255 is 63.75. 75% of 255 is 191.25.



Bug: 1452185

Change-Id: I1e89ad21d0e3007c1f51aa075728732c2856acc3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4598329

Reviewed-by: Florin Malita

Reviewed-by: Steinar H Gunderson

Commit-Queue: Aaron Krajeski

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1166616}

entry.title: Removed the kPriorityIncremental kill switch
entry.content:
This removes support for disabling the use of "incremental"

prioritization for protocols that support HTTP extensible priorities

(currently HTTP/3 only). The feature was successfully shipped and there

is no longer a need for a kill switch for this part of the feature.



This also has the benefit of reducing the number of net_unittests

that run since we no longer need to test with both the feature enabled

and disabled.

entry.title: [css-flex] Fix arithmetic underflow causing ~infinite flexbox width
entry.content:
Turns out ((wtf_size_t)0 - 1) is a very big number.



We were adding gap*(num_items - 1) to the intrinsic with of flex

containers, but only when the container has a child that isn't a flex

item, like an abspos child. When the container had 0 children we

weren't running any of this logic at all as an optimization.

entry.title: Revert "(Temporarily maybe) extend expiration of virtual test suites"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9ef746e2ec1586c75242a3f2477267d05c7cc7ed.



Reason for revert: Expiration of virtual suites is bad only in M114

and M115, so the CL landed in trunk didn't fix the problem, and it

increases the difference between trunk, M114, M115 and M116 for

virtual suite expiration. We should merge crrev.com/c/4611810 into

M114 and M115 instead.

> (Temporarily maybe) extend expiration of virtual test suites

entry.title: SyncPrefs: Return only supported types from GetSelectedTypes()
entry.content:
...for signed-in, non-syncing users.

This ensures that when some client asks "is this type selected", the

answer makes sense: Only types that are actually supported in the

current state will be listed as selected.



(For syncing users, all types are considered supported. For signed-out

users, no types are supported, and GetSelectedTypes() already returns

nothing.)



The idea is that most of the feature checks in the various

ModelTypeControllers or in the SyncApiComponentFactoryImpl can then

be retired, since it'll all be handled in this one central place.



Bug: 1134090

entry.title: [DIPS] Add UMA and don't write empty sites to the DIPS db
entry.content:
In certain cases, empty sites have appeared in the DIPS database. This

CL stops DIPS entries with empty `site` values from being written to

the database at all.



In addition, to assess the prevalence of entries with empty `site`

values and the effectiveness of certain fixes that have been landed in

stopping them, this CL emits a UMA metric whenever an entry with a

blank site is encountered by the DIPSDatabase.



This CL also fixes an issue with the test

`DIPSStorageTest.RemoveByTime_WebAuthnAssertion` where the test url

strings being generated were invalid by adding a (https) scheme to them.



Bug: 1447035

entry.title: SyncService::Initialize: Remove one IsActiveAccountInfoFullyLoaded check
entry.content:
These checks were intended to ensure that the signin state is actually

known. However, recent metrics (see crbug.com/1454037) show that the

signin state is known even when IsActiveAccountInfoFullyLoaded() is

false (i.e. when refresh tokens haven't been loaded yet).



This is a partial reland of crrev.com/c/4632822, which removed this

check plus another one. It turns out that the other check can't be

trivially removed due to some oddities on ChromeOS-Ash.



Bug: 1456707, 1454037

entry.title: Force load advapi32.dll in browser_tests.exe
entry.content:
advapi32.dll is supposed to be delay loaded in chrome.exe, but not in

chrome.dll. browser_tests.exe basically contains _both_ of these and it

inherits the delay load of advapi32.dll while inheriting the desire for

it to not be delay loaded from chrome.dll.



In normal release builds this works fine as advapi32.dll is actually

loaded before main() is even reached. However in asan builds it appears

to not reliably be loaded earlier enough, leading to delay-load

failures.



This change attempts to address that by loading it early in

browser_test's main(). This should also let crrev.com/c/4637485 be

relanded.



Bug: 1459925

Change-Id: I5551544c8b00a106669997609d56c7b0e78fa989

A common pattern in test is to access build-intermediate files directly

in /gen/. This is often generated js files and proto

descriptors. On platforms that "package" tests (fuchsia), these files

end up at the same place as /.



This results in callsites doing:

#if fuchsia

DIR_GEN_TEST_DATA_ROOT

#else

DIR_GEN_TEST_DATA_ROOT + "gen"



This CL:

- Renames DIR_GEN_TEST_DATA_ROOT to DIR_OUT_TEST_DATA_ROOT, which is

roughly $root_out_dir ( on most platforms), to find (test)

binaries.

- Repurposes DIR_GEN_TEST_DATA_ROOT to roughly $root_gen_dir

(/gen on most platforms). This is used to find files generated

during build (e.g. js files and proto descriptors)



Following up on

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4610082 This

CL introduces DIR_OUT_TEST_DATA_ROOT to replace former

DIR_GEN_TEST_DATA_ROOT instead of folding it to DIR_ASSETS



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: cellular: Call RefreshSmdxProfiles in CellularPolicyHandler
entry.content:
This change updates the CellularPolicyHandler class to call

RefreshSmdxProfiles when the feature flag is enabled. This change

updates both the SM-DP+ and SM-DS flows to always query the server

described in the activation code, regardless of whether it is SM-DS or

not, and will attempt to install the first profile returned whose

properties were able to be retrieved and whose state is pending.



Video involving two cellular policies being defined, one with an invalid

activation code and another with a valid activation code:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PPEz2cHWoSx_gQOxNw9YDQudq7G1fuMw/view?usp=sharing

entry.title: [ios] Fix issue with dismissing Settings
entry.content:
This change ensures that cleanUpSettings gets called in cases where the

settings view is dismissed without the coordinator knowing about it. In

those cases, the SceneController may be the last thing retaining the

SettingsNavigationController and so when the variable is cleared it

might be dealloc'd. This change clears the settingsNavigationController

later to ensure cleanUpSettings will be called.



Fixed: 1456555

entry.title: Pass PdfOcr feature flag from Ash to LaCrOS
entry.content:
PDF OCR settings is in accessibility section of devices settings in Ash,

but the feature is run in LaCrOS. To avoid the need to set the flag on

both LaCrOS and ash, it is passed as a commandline switch from Ash to

LaCrOS.



AX-Relnotes: Enabling PDF OCR in Ash also enables it in LaCrOS.

entry.title: [iOS] Update SigninCoordinatorInterrupt::UIShutdownNoDismiss comment
entry.content:
On Chrome shutdown, SceneController needs to shutdown all coordinators

but the scene controller cannot wait for dialog being dismissed.

To fix the DCHECK/CHECK, the sign-in coordinators need to be

interrupted synchronously.



This patch updates headers for:

* SigninCoordinatorInterrupt::UIShutdownNoDismiss

* -[SigninCoordinator interruptWithAction:completion:]



The behaviour changes are done in:

* Add account: http://crrev.com/c/4665592

* UserSigninCoordinator: http://crrev.com/c/4667151

* TrustedVaultReauthenticationCoordinator: http://crrev.com/c/4661527

entry.title: Split CMSs from JS frameworks in UKM.
entry.content:
Follow up to https://crrev.com/c/4529059



While CMSs and JS frameworks

can be detected using similar logic, they should be separated in how

they are exposed in UKM.



Both continue to use the same underlying logic, to avoid introducing

duplicate code for CMSs and JS frameworks.

> [linux/wayland] Implement touchpad hold gesture

>

Reason for revert: Most likely causes test failure of create page dump because data series size is changed https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Cast%20Audio%20Linux/172951/overview



Original change's description:

> webrtc-internals: export timestamp for statistics in the JSON dump

>

> adding a new entry per stats report like this:

> "AP-timestamp": {

> "startTime": "2023-07-06T10:36:30.299Z",

> "endTime": "2023-07-06T10:36:39.950Z",

> "statsType": "media-playout",

> "values": "[1688639790299,more,values,1688639799950]"

> },

>

> BUG=chromium:1462567

entry.title: [iOS] Store reordered overflow menu actions to disk
entry.content:
This CL adds the storage of reordered and show/hidden overflow menu

actions to disk. The OverflowMenuOrder is now the owner of the

ActionCustomizationModel. It provides the model to the action

coordinator and then commits the edit when told that editing is

complete.



There is still some work left here, most noticeably:

- update the open menu's order when editing finishes

- support new actions added to code

These will be in forthcoming CLs.

entry.title: Refactor `PageSpecificContentSettings::MicrophoneCameraState` to EnumSet
entry.content:
Microphone and Camera states are stored in `PageSpecificContentSettings`. Currently, we use the `int32_t` variable to set corresponding bits as flags. This CL replaces `int32_t` with `EnumSet` which allows setting/removing a flag with a high readability.



This CL does not change the behavior of the Microphone and Camera indicators.

entry.title: Do not send SETTINGS_MAX_CONCURRENT_STREAMS.
entry.content:
When sent by the client, this applies to pushed streams. However, push

is already disabled by sending SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH = 0.

See https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9113.html#name-push-responses.

entry.title: Remove expired DiskCache.* histograms
entry.content:
Almost all of the histograms for the blockfile cache in

//net/disk_cache/blockfile are expired. Remove them.



The only remaining blockfile histograms are



DiskCache.0.Error

DiskCache.0.TotalIOTimeRead

DiskCache.0.TotalIOTimeWrite



Remove the blockfile-specific histogram macros in favour of using the standard histogram functions.



Remove supporting code.



Blockfile cache statistics are still recorded, but no longer recorded to

histograms. They are still recorded in the netlog, and some are used in

the upkeep of the cache itself.

entry.title: CRD: Set video capturer frame resolution constraint to display size
entry.content:
Previously video capturer resolution constraint was capped to a max

resolution of 3840x2160.



We found that mismatches in display and video capturer frame sizes lead

to issues with incoming cursor positions in CRD.



Such mismatch scenarios can easily happen e.g. in unified desktop mode

where resolutions are often larger.



This change fixes the mismatch by removing the max resolution

constraint, and instead setting it to the current display size.



Bug: b:289497427

Test: tools/autotest.py -C out/Default --run_all remoting/host/chromeos

entry.title: Fix NoSuchWindow error during navigation
entry.content:
Chrome returns different error messages if it cannot resolve execution

context depending on the place where this happens. ChromeDriver used to

map these error messages to different error codes:

NoSuchExecutionContext and NoSuchWindow. The former one was handled

correctly, ChromeDriver retried the operation, while the second one was

passed to the user. This commit makes sure that both these error

messages get mapped to the same error code that leads to retry.



Bug: chromedriver:4459

Change-Id: I11961602b4ab83d66ec95f1bce082b0882fbd54c

entry.title: Add missing await for async calls in cros settings test api
entry.content:
This commit adds an `await` to `assertAsync` and `assertForDuration`

calls in the cros settings test api in call sites where it was

previously missing.



This surfaced a bug in the implementation of the test api

`backspaceButton()` function, which did not work correctly for pin setup

dialogs. This commit also fixes this issue by making `pinKeyboard()`

behave more intuitively: It now always returns the `pin-keyboard`

element. Previously, it used to return the `setup-pin-keyboard` element

for pin setup dialogs.



Another bug in test code that surfaced was that synthetic key button

presses do not actually change the value of input elements, so all we

can do is check whether the event was suppressed. The test function

verifying keypress ignore logic is now directly analogous to the removed

test cases at quick_unlock_authenticate_browsertest_chromeos.js:626

prior to commit fe25ab7b22258f555e6aec4354a4acfea000a582.



Bug: b/243696986

Change-Id: I07f9a9ed6028bf5350461ebf02bc07921c9a39b7
